riddle: I have hands but no fingers. I move yet I don't walk.
I twinkle in the sky and shine so bright at night.
You see me when you look in water but can't touch me.
I go up but never come down. What am I?
I’m full of keys but can’t open locks.
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. What am I?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
What gets wetter the more it dries?
The more you take, the more you leave behind.
I’m tall when I’m young and short when I’m old.
I fly without wings. I cry without eyes. What am I?
I come down but never go up. What am I?
What has words but never speaks?
What belongs to you but others use it more than you?
The more you take, the bigger I become. What am I?
What has a neck but no head?
I’m not alive but I grow. I don’t have lungs but I need air.
I have one eye but can’t see.
I run but never walk. I have a bed but never sleep.
What gets sharper the more you use it?
I can fill a room but take up no space.
What has four legs in the morning, two at noon, and three in the evening?
I have cities, but no houses. I have water, but no fish.
You can catch me but can’t throw me.
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. Who am I?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
The more you remove from me, the bigger I get.
People buy me to eat, but never eat me.
What has one eye but can’t see anything at all?
If you drop me I’m sure to crack, but give me a smile and I’ll smile back.
